intro: Hymenostephium websteri, commonly known as the Webster's hymenostephium, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, spiraling inflorescence and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal species. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
